intro: Eriocephalus karooicus, commonly known as the Karoo dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptations to dry environments. It produces a yellow flower that develops into a fluffy seed head, aiding in wind dispersal. Eriocephalus karooicus is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, contributing to local biodiversity.
